column4: Is there a way to disable my AC97 in Ubuntu without disabling it in the BIOS?
i guess you might blacklist the driver
So I have to unplug my audio cord whenever I want to run GTA3 and stuff
:P
how so?
I just started using Ubuntu not long ago, and this is my first Linux experience. So I don't know all the ins and outs yet
ive never used it but you might do 'gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist'  and type blacklist drivername
how do I find the driver name for the AC97?
you can type lsmod to see current loaded drivers
so I'm guessing that this would be the one I would blacklist?
snd_ac97_codec
bear in mind im not saying it will def work but yes
thanks. Should I just logout/login to see if it worked?
might reboot
will do
I'll be back and tell you the result
didn't work
So what's that command again? Just so I can undo the change
i kinda doubted :) i guess you can just sudo modprobe -r modulename
what exactly does that do?
mind if you explain this stuff in a PM so I can keep track of it?
